sen.j: 佐味宿那麻呂（さみのすくなまろ）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: SAMI no Sukunamaro lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
SAMI no Sukunamaro was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: SAMI no Sukunamaro was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 名は少麻呂とも書く。
sen.e: Sukunamaro is also written 少麻呂.
Sukunamaro is also written in different Kanji characters, 少麻呂.
sen.cmt: 「別の漢字表記で」という英訳を追記しました。
sen.e: Sukunamaro is also written in different Kanji characters, 少麻呂.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は君、後に朝臣。
sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) is Kimi, later Ason.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi, later Ason.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi, later Ason.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側について戦い、河内から大和に進攻する敵軍に対して大坂の道を守った。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War, in 672, he fought on OAMA no Miko (Prince Oama, the Emperor Tenmu)'s side, and protected the road of Osaka from the enemy force which attacked from Kawachi into Yamato.
In the Jinshin War, in 672, he fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and defended the road of Osaka against the enemy force which advanced from Kawachi into Yamato.
sen.cmt: 大海人皇子の表記を用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War, in 672, he fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and defended the road of Osaka against the enemy force which advanced from Kawachi into Yamato.

sen.j: 685年に山陽道巡察の使者、689年に撰善言司。
sen.e: In 685 he was made as an envoy of Sanyodo patrol, and in 689 he was renamed as Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa.
In 685 he became an envoy of Sanyo-do Road patrol and Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa (an official post to select and compile admonitions) in 689.
sen.cmt: 撰善言司：よきことえらぶつかさ、よごとつくりのつかさ などが読みで見つかりましたが、そのままにしています。ためになるよい言葉、戒めとなる言葉などをえらび集める役職であるため、renameを削除しました。
sen.e: In 685 he became an envoy of Sanyo-do Road patrol and Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa (an official post to select and compile admonitions) in 689.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月29日に飛鳥を襲って挙兵した大伴吹負は、初動の成功を美濃国不破宮にいる大海人皇子に伝えるために使者を出した。
sen.e: Hukei Otomono attacked Asuka on June 29, 672 and raised an army, and he dispatched messengers to inform OAMA no Miko, who was in Huwa no Miya, Mino Province, of the success of initial action.
OTOMO no Fukei rose in arms and attacked Asuka on August 1, 672 and dispatched messengers to Prince Oama in Fuwa no miya, Mino Province, to inform the success of the initial action.
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年6月29日は西暦672年8月1日です。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei rose in arms and attacked Asuka on August 1, 672 and dispatched messengers to Prince Oama in Fuwa no miya, Mino Province, to inform the success of the initial action.

sen.j: 宿那麻呂は、大伴安麻呂、坂上老とともにこの使者になった。
sen.e: Sukunamaro became one of these messengers along with OTOMO no Yasumaro and SAKANOUE no Okina.
Sukunamaro became one of the messengers with OTOMO no Yasumaro and SAKANOUE no Okina.
Sukunamaro became one of the messengers with OTOMO no Yasumaro and SAKANOUE no Okina.

sen.j: 大海人皇子はこの頃不破のそばの野上にあり、不破郡には軍の主力が集結中であった
sen.e: Around then, OAMA no Miko was in Nogami near Huwa, he was gathering the main force of the army in Huwa county.
At that time, Prince Oama was in Nogami near Fuwa, and he was gathering the main force of the army in Fuwa County.
At that time, Prince Oama was in Nogami near Fuwa, and he was gathering the main force of the army in Fuwa County.

sen.j: その後宿那麻呂は吹負のもとに戻り、及楽山（奈良市）に北進する軍に加わった。
sen.e: After that, Sukunamaro returned to Hukei, and joined the army which northed into Narayama (Nara City).
After reporting the success, Sukunamaro returned to the camp of Fukei and joined the troops heading for north, Narayama (Nara City).
sen.cmt: 吹負のもとに -> 吹負の陣営に と解釈しました。
sen.e: After reporting the success, Sukunamaro returned to the camp of Fukei and joined the troops heading for north, Narayama (Nara City).

sen.j: 吹負はその途上の稗田で、おそらく7月2日に、河内国から敵の大軍が来たという情報を得た。
sen.e: Hukei received an information that a large force of the enemy is approaching from Kawachi Province probably on July 2 in Hieda on the way.
On his way to Narayama, Fukei received information in Hieda that a large enemy force was approaching from Kawachi Province, probably on August 3.
sen.cmt: その途上 -> 及楽山に行く途中 と解釈しました。天武天皇元年7月2日は西暦672年8月3日です。
sen.e: On his way to Narayama, Fukei received information in Hieda that a large enemy force was approaching from Kawachi Province, probably on August 3.

sen.j: そこで数百人ずつの三部隊を派遣して防がせた。
sen.e: So he dispatched three units of several hundred and prevented it.
Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.

sen.j: 佐味少麻呂は、数百人を率いて大坂に駐屯した。
sen.e: SAMI no Sukunamaro was stationed in Osaka with several hundred people.
SAMI no Sukunamaro led several hundred people and stationed in Osaka.
SAMI no Sukunamaro led several hundred people and stationed in Osaka.

sen.j: この大坂は大阪のことではなく、生駒山地を東西に通る道の一つである。
sen.e: This Osaka is not the Osaka we know today, but is one of the roads which go through Ikoma Mountain Range from east to west.
The Osaka is not present-day Osaka Prefecture but one of the roads which go through Ikoma Mountain Range from east to west.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The Osaka is not present-day Osaka Prefecture but one of the roads which go through Ikoma Mountain Range from east to west.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』は、竜田に派遣された坂本財ら三百人の部隊が、敵と連戦したことを伝えるが、佐味の部隊の行動については何も記さない。
sen.e: According to "Chronicles of Japan" the troop of three hundred including SAKAMOTO no Takara who was sent by Takida fought a series of battles, but there is nothing is recorded regarding action of the troop of SAMI.

According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the troops of 300-member units including SAKAMOTO no Takara which were dispatched to Tatsuta fought a series of battles, but nothing is mentioned about the troops of SAMI.
sen.cmt: 竜田（たつた）は地名です。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the troops of 300-member units including SAKAMOTO no Takara which were dispatched to Tatsuta fought a series of battles, but nothing is mentioned about the troops of SAMI.

sen.j: 坂本らの部隊と協同して戦ったのか、動かなかったのか不明である。
sen.e: It is unknown whether they fought in cooperation with a military unit of SAKAMOTO or did not move.
It is unknown whether they fought in cooperation with the troops of SAKAMOTO or stayed in the camp.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: It is unknown whether they fought in cooperation with the troops of SAKAMOTO or stayed in the camp.

sen.j: いずれにせよ、おそらく7月5日に、壱伎韓国の大軍が押し寄せると、みな退却を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: In any case they were forced to all retreat when a large army of IKI no Karakuni overwhelmed them on July 5.
In either case, all the troops were forced to retreat when a large enemy force of IKI no Karakuni started the attack presumably on August 6.
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年7月5日は西暦672年8月6日です。
sen.e: In either case, all the troops were forced to retreat when a large enemy force of IKI no Karakuni started the attack presumably on August 6.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）11月1日に、佐味君など52氏が朝臣の姓を授かった。
sen.e: On November 1, 684, 52 people including SAMI no Kimi were given the family name of Ason.
On December 15, 684, 52 clans including SAMI no Kimi were conferred hereditary title of Ason.
sen.cmt: 天武天皇13年11月1日は西暦684年12月15日です。原文の姓は「かばね」と解釈し、かばねの補足説明である(hereditary title)を参照し、英文を変更しました。people -> clans
sen.e: On December 15, 684, 52 clans including SAMI no Kimi were conferred hereditary title of Ason.

sen.j: 天武天皇14年（685年）9月15日に、国司・郡司と百姓の様子を巡察する使者が全国に派遣された。
sen.e: The messenger who patrolled Kokushis(provincial governors), Gunjis(local magistrates) and peasants were deployed throughout the country.

On October 21, 685, the emissaries were dispatched throughout the country to carry out the inspection on the work performance of Kokushis (provincial governors), Gunjis (local magistrates) and working and living conditions of peasants.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け：天武天皇14年（685年）9月15日に天武天皇14年9月15日は西暦685年10月21日です。
sen.e: On October 21, 685, the emissaries were dispatched throughout the country to carry out the inspection on the work performance of Kokushis (provincial governors), Gunjis (local magistrates) and working and living conditions of peasants.

sen.j: 直広肆の佐味朝臣少麻呂は、判官1人史 (律令制)1人を部下として山陽道の使者に任命された。
sen.e: SAMI no Asomi Sukunamaro, Jikikoushi, was ordained as an envoy of Sanyodo with a Hangan and a Shi (the Ritsuryo System).

SAMI no Ason Sukunamaro, Jikikoushi (the sixteenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Jugoinoge, Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), was appointed to an envoy of Sanyo-do Road patrol with a Hangan (inspector) and a Shi (clerk).
sen.cmt: Asomi -> Ason直広肆の補足説明をWeb用語集を参照して追記しました。
sen.e: SAMI no Ason Sukunamaro, Jikikoushi (the sixteenth grade of jikiko rank for vassals of the forty-eight grades of cap rank, which corresponds to Jugoinoge, Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade of Taiho Ritsuryo, Taiho Code), was appointed to an envoy of Sanyo-do Road patrol with a Hangan (inspector) and a Shi (clerk).

sen.j: 持統天皇3年（689年）6月2日に、施基皇子、佐味宿那麻呂、羽田斉、伊余部馬飼、調老人、大伴手拍、巨勢多益須が、撰善言司に任じられた。
sen.e: On June 2, 689, Shiki no Miko, SAMI no Sukunamaro, 羽田斉, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Tauchi, KOSE no Tayasu were ordained as Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa.
On June 27, 689, Prince Shiki, SAMI no Sukunamaro, HATA no Sai, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Tauchi, and KOSE no Tayasu were appointed to Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa.
sen.cmt: 持統天皇3年6月2日は西暦689年6月27日です。羽田斉の読み方を確認できる資料は見つかりませんでした。「はたのさい」としています。
sen.e: On June 27, 689, Prince Shiki, SAMI no Sukunamaro, HATA no Sai, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Tauchi, and KOSE no Tayasu were appointed to Yogoto Tsukuri no Tsukasa.

sen.j: このときも位は直広肆であった。
sen.e: The rank was Jikikoushi then.
His rank was Jikikoushi then.
His rank was Jikikoushi then.
